disease.name: ALK-positive large B-cell lymphoma
disease.primary-site-text: Most common sites of involvement: lymph nodes, mediastinal mass, nasopharynx, tongue, stomach, bone and soft tissues.
disease.alternate-name: Large B-cell lymphoma expressing the ALK kinase and lacking the t(2;5) translocation
disease.definition: This is a neoplasm of ALK-positive monomorphic large immunoblast-like B cells, sometimes with plasmablastic differentiation. This lymphoma is very rare (<1% of DLBCL) with less than 40 cases reported to date.
disease.abstractor-note:
(This code is effective for cases diagnosed 2010 and later. For cases diagnosed prior to 2010, see code 9684/3.)
Most patients present with Stage III/IV. Because these tumors are negative for CD20 antigen, they are insensitive to rituximab.
disease.icd-10-code: C83.3 Diffuse non-Hodgkins lymphoma, large cell (diffuse)
disease.icd-10-cm-code: C84.6 Anaplastic large cell lymphoma, ALK positive
disease.sign: Pain in the chest, abdomen, or bones (for no known reason)
Painless swelling in the lymph nodes
disease.mortality: Age: 36 years median age (9-70 years range)
Survival: median survival 11 months; >156 months survival for children

disease.name: Acute basophilic leukemia
disease.primary-site-text: Primary site must be bone marrow (C421)
disease.definition:
An acute myeloid leukemia in which the primary differentiation is to basophils.
Rare form of acute myeloid leukemia where blasts are accompanied by abnormal basophils in all stages of differentiation.
disease.abstractor-note:
Cutaneous involvement, organomegaly, lytic lesion, and symptoms relating to hyperhistaminemia may be present. Basophilic leukemia is differentiated from other AML subtypes with basophilia using basophilia immunological markers, light microscopic cytochemistry for myeloperoxidase and electron microscopy.
If the leukemia occurs before or simultaneously with Myeloid Sarcoma (9930/3), see M3 and Module 5: PH10
disease.sign: Weight loss or loss of appetite
disease.mortality: Survival: limited information, known cases had poor prognosis

disease.name: Acute biphenotypic leukemia with
disease.icd-9-code: 208.0 Acute leukemia of unspecified cell type
disease.icd-10-code: C95.0 Acute leukemia of unspecified cell type
disease.icd-10-cm-code: C95.0 Acute leukemia of unspecified cell type
